bug.author: steverichey
bug.summary: Exception when importing TuriCreate on a machine with no GPUs
bug.description:
We have a Python script that trains an image classifier using the latest version of TuriCreate. On a MacBook Pro, iMac Pro, or Linux instance with a GPU running in Amazon EC2, this works fine. However, as we have found that training the classifier does not use the GPU, we attempted to train on a compute-optimized machine with no GPU (named c5d.18xlarge in the AWS interface, running Ubuntu 18.04) and received the following error: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "build_model.py", line 1, in <module> import turicreate as tc File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/__init__.py", line 19, in <module> from turicreate.data_structures.sgraph import Vertex, Edge File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/data_structures/__init__.py", line 18, in <module> from . import sframe File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/data_structures/sframe.py", line 16, in <module> from ..connect import main as glconnect File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/connect/main.py", line 13, in <module> from ..cython.cy_unity import UnityGlobalProxy File "turicreate/cython/cy_sarray.pxd", line 92, in init turicreate.cython.cy_unity File "turicreate/cython/cy_model.pxd", line 28, in init turicreate.cython.cy_sarray File "turicreate/cython/cy_model.pyx", line 1, in init turicreate.cython.cy_model File "turicreate/cython/cy_graph.pxd", line 62, in init turicreate.cython.cy_variant File "turicreate/cython/cy_graph.pyx", line 20, in init turicreate.cython.cy_graph File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/util/__init__.py", line 750, in <module> _CUDA_GPUS = _get_cuda_gpus() File "/home/ubuntu/projects/.../venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/util/__init__.py", line 731, in _get_cuda_gpus universal_newlines=True) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 574, in check_output raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd, output=output) subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['nvidia-smi', '--query-gpu=index,gpu_name,memory.free,memory.total', '--format=csv,noheader,nounits']' returned non-zero exit status 9 </denchmark-code>
This poses a challenge as we gain very little benefit from a GPU, but now have to have one in order to run TuriCreate at all. As you can see, the error happens on import turicreate and seems to be because nvidia-smi returns an error, which seems reasonable on a machine with no GPU. Is this a known issue? Is there a workaround? Note that our script doesn't even get as far as allowing us to set tc.config.set_num_gpus to zero so that we are only running on the CPU.
